concise_definition: v. 提到, 提及; n. 提及, 提到

definitions.explanation_en: To refer to something or someone briefly or incidentally in speech or writing, without going into detail.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在言语或文字中简要地、非重点地提及某人或某事，不展开详细说明。
definitions.example_en: She mentioned her trip to Japan in passing during the meeting.
definitions.example_cn: 她在会议中顺带提到了自己去日本的旅行。

definitions.explanation_en: To acknowledge or call attention to someone’s achievement, contribution, or existence, often in a formal or public context.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在正式或公开场合中承认或指出某人的成就、贡献或存在，以示认可。
definitions.example_en: The CEO mentioned the team’s hard work in his speech at the annual gala.
definitions.example_cn: 首席执行官在年会演讲中提到了团队的辛勤工作。

definitions.explanation_en: A brief reference or allusion to someone or something, often in writing or speech.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在言语或文字中对某人或某事的简短提及或暗示。
definitions.example_en: There was no mention of the budget shortfall in the report.
definitions.example_cn: 报告中并未提及预算缺口。

definitions.explanation_en: An act of acknowledging or honoring someone publicly, especially in a formal setting.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在正式场合中公开承认或表彰某人的一种行为。
definitions.example_en: He received a special mention for his outstanding service to the community.
definitions.example_cn: 他因对社区的杰出服务而获得特别表彰。

comparison.analysis: “Reference”（引用/提及）通常指更正式、更具体的引用，常用于学术、法律或技术语境中，可能包含出处或来源。而 “mention” 更随意、更简略，不一定有出处，仅表示‘提到’。
“Note”（注意/指出）可以是书面或口头的提醒、评论或观察，常带有分析或评价的意味，如 ‘Note that the deadline has changed.’ 而 “mention” 更中性，仅表示‘提及’，不隐含评价或强调。
“Allude”（暗示）指间接、含蓄地提及某事，通常不直接说出，依赖语境让听者领会。而 “mention” 是直接、明确的提及，没有隐藏含义。例如：He alluded to the scandal（他暗示了丑闻） vs. He mentioned the scandal（他提到了丑闻）。
